description: The NetworkIsolationDiagnoseConnectFailureAndGetInfo function gets information about a network isolation connection failure due to a missing capability. This function can be used to identify the capabilities required to connect to a server.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
name: NetworkIsolationDiagnoseConnectFailureAndGetInfo

arguments.name: wszServerName
arguments.description: Type: LPCWSTR Name (or IP address literal string) of the server to which a connection was attempted.

arguments.name: netIsoError
arguments.description: Type: NETISO_ERROR_TYPE* The error that has occurred, indicating which network capability was missing and thus caused the failure.

description: The NetworkIsolationEnumAppContainers function enumerates all of the app containers that have been created in the system.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise. ERROR_OUTOFMEMORY will be returned if memory is unavailable.
remarks: If no app containers are installed on the system, ERROR_SUCCESS will still be returned (and ppPublicAppCs will be empty).
name: NetworkIsolationEnumAppContainers

arguments.name: Flags
arguments.description: Type: DWORD May be set to NETISO_FLAG_FORCE_COMPUTE_BINARIES to ensure that all binaries are computed before the app container is returned. This flag should be set if the caller requires up-to-date and complete information on app container binaries. If this flag is not set, returned data may be stale or incomplete.  See NETISO_FLAG for more information.

arguments.name: pdwNumPublicAppCs
arguments.description: Type: DWORD* The number of app containers in the ppPublicAppCs member.

arguments.name: ppPublicAppCs
arguments.description: Type: PINET_FIREWALL_APP_CONTAINER* The list of app container structure elements.

description: The NetworkIsolationEnumerateAppContainerRules function enumerates all of the rules related to app containers.
return_value: Type: HRESULT If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
name: NetworkIsolationEnumerateAppContainerRules

arguments.name: newEnum
arguments.description: Type: IEnumVARIANT** Enumerator interface of an INetFwRule3 object that represents the rules enforcing app containers.

description: The NetworkIsolationFreeAppContainers function is used to release memory resources allocated to one or more app containers
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
name: NetworkIsolationFreeAppContainers

arguments.name: pPublicAppCs
arguments.description: Type: PINET_FIREWALL_APP_CONTAINER The app container memory resources to be freed.

description: The NetworkIsolationGetAppContainerConfig function is used to retrieve configuration information about one or more app containers.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
remarks: Note that it is the calling program's responsibility to free the memory associated with the PSID_AND_ATTRIBUTES structure. The following code sample shows how to call this function. The FreeAppContainerConfig function shows how to free all of the associated memory.
name: NetworkIsolationGetAppContainerConfig

arguments.name: pdwNumPublicAppCs
arguments.description: Type: DWORD* The number of app containers in the appContainerSids member.

arguments.name: appContainerSids
arguments.description: Type: PSID_AND_ATTRIBUTES* The security identifiers (SIDs) of app containers that are allowed to send loopback traffic. Used for debugging purposes.

description: The NetworkIsolationRegisterForAppContainerChanges function is used to register for the delivery of notifications regarding changes to an app container.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
name: NetworkIsolationRegisterForAppContainerChanges

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Type: DWORD A bitmask value of control flags which specify when to receive notifications. May contain one or more of the following flags.   ValueMeaning  INET_FIREWALL_AC_NONE 0x00   No notifications will be delivered.   INET_FIREWALL_AC_PACKAGE_ID_ONLY  0x01   Notifications will be delivered when an app container is created with a package identifier.   INET_FIREWALL_AC_BINARY 0x02   Notifications will be delivered when  an app container is created with a binary path.   INET_FIREWALL_AC_MAX 0x04   Maximum value for testing purposes.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: Type: PAC_CHANGES_CALLBACK_FN Function pointer that will be invoked when a notification is ready for delivery.

arguments.name: context
arguments.description: Type: PVOID Optional context pointer. This pointer is passed to the callback function along with details of the change.

arguments.name: registrationObject
arguments.description: Type: HANDLE* Handle to the newly created registration.

description: The NetworkIsolationSetAppContainerConfig function is used to set the configuration of one or more app containers.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
name: NetworkIsolationSetAppContainerConfig

arguments.name: dwNumPublicAppCs
arguments.description: Type: DWORD The number of app containers in the appContainerSids member.

arguments.name: appContainerSids
arguments.description: Type: PSID_AND_ATTRIBUTES The security identifiers (SIDs) of app containers that are allowed to send loopback traffic. Used for debugging purposes.

description: The NetworkIsolationSetupAppContainerBinaries function is used by software installers to provide information about the image paths of applications that are running in an app container.   This information is provided to third-party firewall applications about the applications in order to enhance user experience and security decisions.
return_value: Type: HRESULT If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. If the function fails, it returns an HRESULT value that indicates the error. For a list of common error codes, see Common HRESULT Values.
remarks: Applications creating an app container can use NetworkIsolationSetupAppContainerBinaries to provide third-party firewall applications with  the direct path to applications running inside that app container.
name: NetworkIsolationSetupAppContainerBinaries

arguments.name: applicationContainerSid
arguments.description: Type: PSID The package identifier of the app container.

arguments.name: packageFullName
arguments.description: Type: LPCWSTR A string representing the package identity of the app that owns this app container. Contains the 5-part tuple as individual fields (name, version, architecture, resourceid, publisher).

arguments.name: packageFolder
arguments.description: Type: LPCWSTR The file location of the app that owns this app container.

arguments.name: displayName
arguments.description: Type: LPCWSTR The friendly name of the app container.

arguments.name: bBinariesFullyComputed
arguments.description: Type: BOOL True if the binary files are being provided by the caller; otherwise, false.

arguments.name: binaries
arguments.description: Type: LPCWSTR* An array of paths to the applications running in the app container.

arguments.name: binariesCount
arguments.description: Type: DWORD The number of paths contained in the binaries parameter.

description: The NetworkIsolationUnregisterForAppContainerChanges function  is used to cancel an app container change registration and stop receiving notifications.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
name: NetworkIsolationUnregisterForAppContainerChanges

arguments.name: registrationObject
arguments.description: Type: HANDLE Handle to the previously created registration.

description: The PAC_CHANGES_CALLBACK_FN  function is used to add custom behavior to the app container change notification process.
return_value: This function pointer does not return a value.
remarks: Call NetworkIsolationRegisterForAppContainerChanges to register this callback function.
name: PAC_CHANGES_CALLBACK_FN pointer

arguments.name: context
arguments.description: Type: void* Optional context pointer. It contains the value of the context parameter of the NetworkIsolationRegisterForAppContainerChanges function.

arguments.name: pChange
arguments.description: Type: const INET_FIREWALL_AC_CHANGE* The app container change information.
